intro: Trixis oligantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved trixis, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and dense clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant has fibrous roots that help it survive in dry conditions, and its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its resilience, it is sometimes used in local landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to withstand drought.
